ShortestPath2220674052
  • API Dokümantasyonu

API Dokümantasyonu

Shortest Path Algorithm Implementation using Dijkstra’s algorithm. This module provides functions to find the shortest path between nodes in a graph.

shortestpath2220674052.shortestpath.create_graph_from_edges(edges: List[Tuple[Any, Any, float]]) → Dict[Any, Dict[Any, float]][source]

Creates a graph from a list of edges.

Parameters:

edges – A list of tuples (node1, node2, weight) representing the edges.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the graph.

shortestpath2220674052.shortestpath.dijkstra(graph: Dict[Any, Dict[Any, float]], start: Any) → Tuple[Dict[Any, float], Dict[Any, Any]][source]

Implements Dijkstra’s algorithm to find shortest paths from a starting node.

Parameters:

  • graph – A dictionary representing the graph where keys are nodes and values are dictionaries of neighboring nodes and their edge weights.

  • start – The starting node.

Returns:

  • A dictionary of shortest distances from start to each node.

  • A dictionary of predecessors for each node.

Return type:

A tuple containing

shortestpath2220674052.shortestpath.get_shortest_path(graph: Dict[Any, Dict[Any, float]], start: Any, end: Any) → Tuple[List[Any] | None, float | None][source]

Finds the shortest path between start and end nodes in a graph.

Parameters:

  • graph – A dictionary representing the graph.

  • start – The starting node.

  • end – The destination node.

Returns:

  • The shortest path as a list of nodes (None if no path exists).

  • The total distance of the path (None if no path exists).

Return type:

A tuple containing
